ruleset.name: Custom MyCoRe rules
ruleset.description: This ruleset contains custom MyCoRe rules

rule.name: MCR.Configuration.PublicFieldsAndMethods
rule.message: A field or method annotated with a configuration annotation (like @MCRProperty) needs to be public

property.name: xpath
property.value: //ClassBody/(FieldDeclaration|MethodDeclaration) [ ModifierList/Annotation/ClassType[pmd-java:typeIs('org.mycore.common.config.annotation.MCRFactory')] or ModifierList/Annotation/ClassType[pmd-java:typeIs('org.mycore.common.config.annotation.MCRInstance')] or ModifierList/Annotation/ClassType[pmd-java:typeIs('org.mycore.common.config.annotation.MCRInstanceList')] or ModifierList/Annotation/ClassType[pmd-java:typeIs('org.mycore.common.config.annotation.MCRInstanceMap')] or ModifierList/Annotation/ClassType[pmd-java:typeIs('org.mycore.common.config.annotation.MCRPostConstruction')] or ModifierList/Annotation/ClassType[pmd-java:typeIs('org.mycore.common.config.annotation.MCRProperty')] or ModifierList/Annotation/ClassType[pmd-java:typeIs('org.mycore.common.config.annotation.MCRRawProperties')] ] [ not(@Visibility='public') ]

rule.name: MCR.Logger.MaxOneField
rule.message: There should only be one field with name 'logger' or 'LOGGER' and type 'Logger'

rule.name: MCR.Logger.MatchingLoggerType
rule.message: A field with name 'logger' or 'LOGGER' should have type 'Logger'

rule.name: MCR.Logger.MatchingFieldName
rule.message: A field with type 'Logger' should have name 'logger' or 'LOGGER'

rule.name: MCR.Logger.CorrectLoggerType
rule.message: A field with type 'Logger' should have name actual type 'org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger'

rule.name: MCR.Logger.CorrectStaticInitialisation
rule.message: A field with type 'Logger' and name 'LOGGER' should be initialized as 'private static final Logger LOGGER = LogManager.getLogger();'

property.name: xpath
property.value: //ClassBody/FieldDeclaration [ ClassType[@SimpleName='Logger'] and VariableDeclarator/VariableId/@Name='LOGGER' ] [ not( deep-equal(pmd-java:modifiers(), ('private','static','final')) and VariableDeclarator/MethodCall[ TypeExpression/ClassType[@SimpleName='LogManager'] and @MethodName='getLogger' and count(*)=2 and count(ArgumentList/*)=0 ] ) ]

rule.name: MCR.Logger.CorrectDynamicInitialisation
rule.message: A field with type 'Logger' and name 'logger' should be initialized as 'protected final Logger logger = LogManager.getLogger(getClass());'

property.name: xpath
property.value: //ClassBody/FieldDeclaration [ ClassType[@SimpleName='Logger'] and VariableDeclarator/VariableId/@Name='logger' ] [ not( deep-equal(pmd-java:modifiers(), ('protected','final')) and VariableDeclarator/MethodCall[ TypeExpression/ClassType[@SimpleName='LogManager'] and @MethodName='getLogger' and count(*)=2 and count(ArgumentList/*)=1 and ArgumentList[1][ MethodCall[ @MethodName='getClass' and count(*)=1 and count(ArgumentList/*)=0 ] ] ] ) ]

rule.name: MCR.Logger.IndirectAccess
rule.message: A field with name 'Logger' should be accessed directly (either logger.info(...) or this.logger.info(...))

rule.name: MCR.Singleton.MethodModifiers
rule.message: A method named 'getInstance' should be static

rule.name: MCR.Singleton.MethodReturnType
rule.message: A method named 'getInstance' should return an instance of the enclosing class

rule.name: MCR.Singleton.ClassModifiers
rule.message: A singleton class (with method named 'getInstance') should be final

rule.name: MCR.Singleton.PrivateConstructor
rule.message: A singleton class with (method named 'getInstance') should have a private constructor

rule.name: MCR.Singleton.NonPrivateConstructors
rule.message: A singleton class with (method named 'getInstance') should only have a private constructors

rule.name: MCR.SerialVersionUid.ModifiersAndType
rule.message: The serialVersionUID should have modifiers private static final and type long

rule.name: MCR.SerialVersionUid.Annotation
rule.message: The serialVersionUID should be annotated with @java.io.Serial

rule.name: MCR.SerialVersionUid.Value
rule.message: The serialVersionUID should have literal value '1L'

rule.name: MCR.ResourceResolver
rule.message: Resources should be accessed using MCRResourceResolver or MCRResourceHelper
rule.description: Accessing resources directly via Class, ClassLoader or ServletContext should only be done - in classes that are part of the setup of the MyCoRe application (e.g. MCRConfigurationInputStream, MCRComponent), - in classes that are used by MCRResourceResolver (e.g. MCRResourceProvider, MCRResourceLocator) or - in rare cases where module specific files need to be accessed (e.g. MCRCoreVersion accessing git.properties). Otherwise, MCRResourceResolver or MCRResourceHelper should be used.
